intro: Ancylacanthus, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields. Ancylacanthus is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
